Posts.Content: Hi there - I'm an 8-year breast cancer survivor and I would very much like to help you by answering your question. I have a website that might help you and your mother: Link removed as it is not to a personal blog. I write a daily post about some aspect of the breast cancer journey and if you don't find the information you're looking for, let me know and I'll do some specific research for you. Sending you lots of love and healing today.
Posts.Title: How to make post cancer life as normal as possible.

Posts.Content: Hi there - Yes, I'm an 8-year breast cancer survivor and I used thermography but only after my breast cancer diagnosis. I loved it. I found it to be an incredibly useful diagnostic tool and in fact I wrote a blog post about it which you can check out here: < link deleted as per policy...please read our policies and comply> The reason I used it after the breast cancer diagnosis was because I liked the idea of seeing potential hot spots that might become a problem later on down the track (I didn't have any, luckily!). It's sad that the cost of this treatment usually isn't covered by insurance - at least in America it isn't, it was by some insurance companies in Australia. I believe we should have better access to this mode of diagnostic imaging.
Posts.Signature: Wishing you a healing journey, Marnie http://MarnieClark.com
Posts.Title: Thermography anyone?

Posts.Content: Hi Confused 12 - I know it's been a little while since you asked this question and I hope you got some good answers and that there are no problems. Just for future reference, you might like to know about Thermal Imaging as another form of diagnostics for dense breasts. I wrote a blog post about it and here's the link to it:Link removed as it is not to a personal blog. I am an 8-year breast cancer survivor and I write a daily blog about getting through breast cancer, but also tips on how to keep yourself healthy. Hope you find it helpful. Sending love and light to you today. xoxox
